page.title: 02KILBURN(DERBY)AREA HOUSING
page.content: Kilburn village has seen a lot of new housing in the last 25 years, and there are few houses which were built in the last century. The majority of the village's houses are home_owned and are of brick and tiles rather than stone and slate. Most of the housing in Denby village is relatively new, but the housing of Denby Bottles is chiefly a 1930s council development, also of brick. There are some older houses in the Rawson Green and Cinderhill area, but a similar age to that of Denby Bottles. Openwoodgate has some larger houses, but little modern development and a number of stone houses, typical of Belper. Holbrook also has a sizeable proportion of stone houses. Horsley Woodhouse's housing is chiefly 1930's Council housing.
